disasters.short_description: A sudden and violent shaking of the ground, often causing destruction.
disasters.effects: Building collapses, landslides, tsunamis, infrastructure damage.

do: Drop, Cover, and Hold under a sturdy table.
Stay indoors until shaking stops.
Move to an open area away from buildings if outside.
Keep emergency supplies ready.
dont: Don't use elevators.
Don't run outside immediately.
Don't stand near windows or heavy furniture.
Don't ignore aftershocks.

disasters.short_description: An overflow of water submerging land, often due to heavy rainfall or dam failures.

do: Move to higher ground immediately.
Turn off electricity and gas.
Store clean drinking water.
Follow evacuation orders.
dont: Don't walk or drive through floodwaters.
Don't touch electrical equipment in wet areas.
Don't drink contaminated water.
Don't ignore weather warnings.

disasters.short_description: An uncontrolled fire in forested or grassland areas, spreading rapidly.
disasters.effects: Air pollution, destruction of vegetation, wildlife loss, property damage.

do: Evacuate immediately if advised.
Wear an N95 mask to reduce smoke inhalation.
Keep emergency supplies ready.
Clear dry leaves and flammable materials from surroundings.
dont: Don't stay in smoke-filled areas.
Don't return to burned areas until safe.
Don't ignore evacuation warnings.
Don't leave campfires unattended.

disasters.short_description: A series of large ocean waves caused by underwater earthquakes or volcanic eruptions.
disasters.effects: Severe flooding, coastal destruction, loss of life.

do: Move to higher ground immediately.
Stay away from the coast until an official all-clear is given.
Listen to emergency alerts.
Keep an emergency kit ready.
dont: Don't go near the shore to watch waves.
Don't ignore official warnings.
Don't delay evacuation.
Don't use coastal roads during warnings.

disasters.short_description: A powerful tropical storm with strong winds and heavy rain.
disasters.effects: Storm surges, flooding, infrastructure damage, power outages.

do: Secure doors and windows before the storm hits.
Stock up on food, water, and batteries.
Evacuate if instructed by authorities.
Stay indoors and away from windows.
dont: Don't go outside during the storm.
Don't ignore evacuation orders.
Don't drive in flooded areas.
Don't use candles due to fire risk.

disasters.short_description: A rapidly rotating column of air extending from a thunderstorm to the ground.
disasters.effects: Severe damage to buildings, vehicles, and trees.

do: Take shelter in a basement or an interior room without windows.
Cover yourself with heavy furniture or a mattress.
Listen to weather alerts and warnings.
Secure outdoor objects that may become projectiles.
dont: Don't stay in mobile homes or vehicles.
Don't try to outrun a tornado in a car.
Don't open windows to equalize pressure.
Don't ignore tornado sirens.

disasters.short_description: A mass movement of rock, debris, or earth down a slope.
disasters.effects: Burial of structures, road blockages, loss of life.

do: Move to higher ground if in a landslide-prone area.
Stay alert to changes in water flow or cracks in walls.
Evacuate immediately if authorities advise.
Keep an emergency supply kit ready.
dont: Don't build near steep slopes or unstable land.
Don't ignore warning signs like sudden cracks in the ground.
Don't remain in areas affected by recent heavy rains.
Don't return until authorities declare it safe.

disasters.short_description: A prolonged period of insufficient rainfall, leading to water shortages.
disasters.effects: Crop failures, water scarcity, food shortages, wildfires.

do: Use water efficiently and avoid wastage.
Store emergency water supplies.
Follow government restrictions on water usage.
Grow drought-resistant plants in affected areas.
dont: Don't waste drinking water.
Don't ignore water rationing rules.
Don't overuse groundwater sources.
Don't burn dry vegetation near homes.

disasters.short_description: A global disease outbreak affecting a large population.
disasters.effects: High illness rates, economic impact, travel restrictions.

do: Wear a mask in crowded places.
Wash hands frequently with soap and water.
Get vaccinated if available.
Maintain social distancing.
dont: Don't spread misinformation.
Don't ignore public health advisories.
Don't stockpile essential supplies unnecessarily.
Don't travel unless necessary during outbreaks.

disasters.short_description: A sudden explosion or release of lava and gases from a volcano.
disasters.effects: Ashfall, lava flows, toxic gas emissions, earthquakes.

do: Evacuate immediately if warned.
Wear a mask to prevent inhaling ash.
Stay indoors and keep windows closed.
Keep emergency supplies ready.
dont: Don't stay near rivers or valleys during an eruption.
Don't ignore evacuation orders.
Don't inhale volcanic ash without protection.
Don't drink water from exposed sources.
